structured.description: A 3D camera class called `Camera3D`. It includes various methods for calculating the camera's projection and view matrices based on user input and other factors such as aspect ratio and field of view. The code also includes a `processInput()` method that handles keyboard and mouse inputs, allowing the camera to move and rotate in response.

items.description: Is an extension of the Camera class with additional functionality to handle 3D camera inputs. It has a constructor that takes fov, aspect, zNear, and zFar parameters to calculate the projection matrix, and an adjustToViewport method to set the viewport size. The processInput method processes keyboard and mouse input to rotate and move the camera.
items.name: Camera3D

items.description: Calculates a matrix that represents the projection of a 3D scene onto a 2D image plane, based on provided camera data.

params.name: data
params.description: 3D camera parameters for which the projection matrix should be calculated.

returns.description: a Matrix4f object containing the camera's projection matrix.

items.name: calculateProjectionMatrix

items.description: Adjusts the camera's projection and view matrices to fit within the viewport specified by the user. It also sets the viewport size and positions the camera at the origin.

params.name: width
params.description: 2D viewport width for which the projection and view matrices are calculated and then set as the GL_VIEWPORT value.

params.name: height
params.description: 2D viewport size, which is used to calculate the appropriate projection and view matrices for the 3D scene.

usage.description: In this example, we create an instance of the Camera3D class and use its adjustToViewport method to adjust the viewport to have a width of 800 and height of 600.

items.name: adjustToViewport

items.description: Is a custom implementation of the Camera Struct for a 3D environment. It contains four instance fields: fov, aspect, zNear, and zFar, which are used to calculate the perspective projection matrix in the calculateProjectionMatrix method. The class also includes a getAsMatrix4 method that returns the perspective projection matrix as a Matrix4f object.
items.name: CameraStruct3D

items.description: Initializes a matrix representing a perspective projection with field of view (fov), aspect ratio, near and far distances.

returns.description: a matrix representation of a perspective projection, initialized with the specified field of view, aspect ratio, near and far distances.

usage.code:
Camera3D camera = new Camera3D(70, 16 / 9, 0.1f, 100);
Matrix4f projectionMatrix = camera.getAsMatrix4();

items.name: getAsMatrix4

items.description: Processes mouse input and keyboard input to move a 3D object based on user inputs.

params.name: dt
params.description: time step of the animation, which determines the amount of movement the object undergoes during each frame.

params.name: speed
params.description: 3D movement speed of the object being controlled by the code, and it is multiplied by the time elapsed (represented by `dt`) to determine the total distance traveled during the frame.

params.name: sens
params.description: sensitivity of the mouse input, which determines how much the character will move based on the distance of the mouse cursor from the center of the screen.

items.name: processInput

items.description: Moves an entity by a specified amount along a given direction, using the transform's `setPos()` method.

params.name: dir
params.description: 3D direction in which the object should be moved, with the movement amount being applied to its position.

params.name: amt
params.description: amount of movement along the specified direction, which is added to the current position of the transform.

items.name: move

structured.description: An abstract class `Camera` which is responsible for managing camera transformations and projections in a 3D scene. The camera's view matrix is calculated based on its position and rotation, and then multiplied with the projection matrix to produce the final view-projection matrix. This matrix is used to transform points from world coordinates to screen coordinates.

items.description: Is an abstract base class for managing camera transformations in a 3D environment. It maintains matrices for projection and view projections, as well as a transformation object to store the camera's position and rotation.
items.name: Camera

items.description: Returns a matrix representing the combined view and projection transformations. If no cached result is available or if the transformation has changed, it calculates the view matrix using the `calculateViewMatrix` method before returning the combined view-projection matrix.

returns.description: a `Matrix4f` object representing the view-projection matrix.

usage.description: This example creates a new instance of the Camera class and sets its transformation position. It then calls the getViewProjection method to retrieve the view projection matrix.

items.name: getViewProjection

items.description: Calculates a view matrix by combining camera rotation and translation matrices. It takes the conjugate of the camera's rotated transform, creates a translation matrix from the camera's position, and then multiplies these two matrices with the projection matrix to produce the final view matrix.

returns.description: a Matrix4f representing the view matrix.

items.name: calculateViewMatrix

items.description: Calculates a translation matrix based on a given camera position, which is obtained by multiplying the transformed position of an object with -1. It then initializes a new Matrix4f object with the resulting x, y, and z coordinates to represent a translation transformation.

returns.description: a translation matrix with specified x, y, z coordinates.

items.name: getTranslationMatrix

items.description: Retrieves and returns an instance of a `Transform` object. This object is stored as a class variable or field named `transform`. The function does not perform any operations, but rather provides read-only access to the existing transform object.

usage.code:
Camera camera = new Camera(projection);
Transform transform = camera.getTransform();

items.name: getTransform

items.description: Is an abstract class that serves as a structure for camera-related data. It provides a base template for concrete implementations to inherit from and extend its functionality. This class defines a single abstract method getAsMatrix4, which allows derived classes to convert their internal state into a Matrix4f object.
items.name: CameraStruct

structured.description: A Texture class that loads and manages texture images using the OpenGL library. The class uses LWJGL (Lightweight Java Game Library) for its low-level graphics operations and AWT (Abstract Window Toolkit) for image handling. The loadTexture method reads an image file, converts it to a pixel buffer, generates an OpenGL texture object, and configures it with parameters such as filtering, wrapping, and minification.

items.description: Loads an image file and generates a texture ID for use in OpenGL rendering. It provides methods to bind the texture to a specific sampler slot and retrieve the generated ID. The class is designed to handle RGBA images with alpha channel support.
items.name: Texture

items.description: Calls another function with a default argument value of 0 when invoked without any parameters. The purpose is to establish or configure an object, connection, or binding between two entities.
items.name: bind

items.description: Specifies the texture unit to be used for rendering a two-dimensional texture. It binds the specified texture with the given identifier to the active texture unit, ensuring that it is ready for usage by OpenGL.

params.name: samplerSlot
params.description: 32-bit integer index of the texture unit that will be bound to the current OpenGL context.

items.name: bind

items.description: Retrieves and returns an integer value representing the ID. This value is stored in a variable named `id`. The function does not modify or manipulate the value, it simply exposes it to external access.

returns.description: an integer value representing a unique identifier.

usage.code:
Texture texture = new Texture("path_to_your_image.png");
int id = texture.getID();

items.name: getID

items.description: Loads a texture from a file, converts it into a format suitable for OpenGL, and returns an ID that can be used to access the texture. It handles RGBA textures with or without alpha channel.

params.name: fileName
params.description: name of the file containing the image to be loaded and used as a texture.

returns.description:
an integer representing a generated texture ID.

Returns an integer representing the ID of a texture. This ID is unique for each texture generated by the function and can be used to identify and manipulate the corresponding texture within OpenGL.

items.name: loadTexture
